intro: Adenostephanus obversiflorus, commonly known as the narrow-leaved stephanus, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, while the flowers are small and clustered in dense, spherical heads. Adenostephanus obversiflorus is often found in fynbos vegetation, which is known for its high biodiversity and unique ecological adaptations.
